divs: Sighting DetailsIn Warren, Michigan, at apx. 11p.m., I stepped out onto the front porch (facing south). Watching the neighborhood fireworks, I happened to notice bright lights sitting stationary amid the fireworks. They were in a tight, horizontal row and golden-white in color. The middle one was slightly larger. I could faintly make out an amber-reddish glow around the periphery of each. It appeared to be three lights on one object. They were steady, not pulsating. Every once in a while, they would grow alittle bit brighter, then dimmer. Initially, I thought it was a firework with a delayed explosion, but it never exploded. Then, I thought it was an airplane making its ascent from a nearby airport, considering how low on the horizon it was (less than 45 degrees). But the lights were too golden, and the object was stationary. Convinced it wasn't conventional, I ran inside for 2 seconds to grab my camera-phone. When I got back outside, the lights had dimmed to a pale orange, but the object had not moved. I aimed my camera at it, and it suddenly tilted at an angle (diagonal) and made a rather hasty departure to the right of me (west). It flew behind the nearby treeline, and I lost sight of it. Didn't see it again.
Summary: Object w/three bright golden-white lights, with amber-red "aura"...hovered for apx. 5 min. before tilting and moving sideways out of sight.
